Title.evidence: The study did not provide details on trial registration, randomization, blinding, or funding sources.

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective cohort study was conducted at a single academic institution.

Participants.evidence: involving patients who underwent open surgery for gynecologic malignancies using ERAS protocols from March 2016 to December 2018.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were categorized into two cohorts based on the presence or absence of postoperative AKI within 30 days.

Objective.evidence: The objective of this study was to compare the development of long-term chronic kidney disease (CKD) and cardiac conditions postoperatively among patients who did and did not develop acute kidney injury (AKI) following open ERAS surgery for gynecologic malignancy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the 36-month cumulative incidence of CKD.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The study did not provide details on trial registration, randomization, blinding, or funding sources.

Blinding.evidence: The study did not provide details on trial registration, randomization, blinding, or funding sources.

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study did not provide details on trial registration, randomization, blinding, or funding sources.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Out of 378 patients, 51 (13.5%) developed postoperative AKI.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Univariate analysis showed that AKI was associated with CKD (HR=2.17, 95% CI 1.22–3.84).

Harms.evidence: The study did not provide details on trial registration, randomization, blinding, or funding sources.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study did not provide details on trial registration, randomization, blinding, or funding sources.

Funding.evidence: The study did not provide details on trial registration, randomization, blinding, or funding sources.
